description.narrative: The proposed project is an investment in Pragati India Fund Limited, an SME focused fund that will focus on the economically under-developed low income states (LIS) of India such as Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh and Orissa. IFCs support to the company will help Pragati to partner with existing businesses, entrepreneurs and managers who have demonstrated execution ability. Pragatis investment strategy is to expand into low income states and rural regions where changing political, social and economic development dynamics offer new opportunities that are largely untapped. The regional orientation provides opportunities in early stage investments which leverage ideas that are successful elsewhere in the Indian context and adapt them to suit local conditions.

The team expects high development in the following areas: 1. Flow of private capital to LIS - Focus of the Fund's investments will be for the benefit of companies and projects in LIS 2. Support of SMEs - The target investee companies will be small to medium enterprises 3. Private sector development - The target companies will benefit from value-added practices that include increased corporate governance, environmental and social standards and transparency. 4. Accelerated growth - Providing advice and risk capital to enable faster growth in portfolio companies. 5. Job creation - Supporting high growth companies which will reach the bottom of the pyramid and create employment at a faster rate than the national average.
